q: Identify the coordination geometry of the Jahn–Teller active complex [Cu(H2O)6]2+.
logic: Cu(II) is a d9 system. Degeneracy in the eg orbitals causes axial elongation, producing a tetragonally distorted octahedron.

q: In Michaelis–Menten kinetics, what is the specificity constant?
logic: kcat/KM measures catalytic efficiency and substrate preference at low substrate concentration.

q: What is the stereochemical outcome of the Mitsunobu reaction of a secondary alcohol?
logic: The reaction proceeds via SN2 displacement of an alkoxyphosphonium intermediate, resulting in inversion.

q: An orbital has 1 radial node and 2 angular nodes. What are n and l?
logic: Angular nodes = l = 2. Radial nodes = n − l − 1 = 1, giving n = 4.

q: What is the Joule–Thomson coefficient for an ideal gas?
logic: For an ideal gas, enthalpy depends only on temperature, so μJT = 0.
